謹

Значения

Быть осторожным, избегать; почтительность; осторожничать

Мнемоника

Справа — выжженная земля. Говорить 言 не спеша, словно по безводной пустыне идёшь.

Варианты

謹, 谨

koohiiStory1: Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I discreetly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog.
koohiiStory2: Cabbage primitive: When a cabbage is growing up, you must put it in your mouth before it flowers, because that´s when it becomes bitter. Seriously, it´s called ´bolting´ or something. When you´re discreet, you try to make your words like a cabbage: well-layered, but in an unassuming way.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You say something to a boot when you want to be humble. You're down there because you're bowing in front of the person you're humbling yourself before. Because of that, your face is really close to their boots and you're speaking directly at them, instead of at the person's face, so it's more discreet.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself trying to be humble. You're down on the ground talking to a pair of boots. You don't dare raise your eyes past that.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're being humble like this because those boots belong to the King (きん) of England. You can't just say whatever you want at eye level to a king. He'll have your head chopped off for insolence, or worse!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine saying something to the King. Get low down on the ground to be as humble as you can. Whisper into the King's boots. Lick them if you have to.

humanum_short_description_en:
"Shuowen": "Sincerely, stunned. From the sound of words." " Jin " means cautious and careful.

Bronze writing "堇", " Jin " is the last word of "堇". Qiqiu: "Qi Congzheng, Jin (sincere) do not worry (disturb)." "Shin (sincere) do not worry (disturb)" still said, "Be careful, no confusion." (See Linyi He, Huang Xiquan). See " Single ".
humanum_short_description:
《說文》：「謹，愼也。从言堇聲。」「謹」表示慎重、小心。

　　金文寫作「堇」，「謹」是「堇」的後起字。啟卣：「啟從征，堇(謹)不憂(擾)。」「堇(謹)不憂(擾)」猶言「謹慎小心，沒有錯亂。」(參何琳儀、黃錫全)。參見「堇」。
